means: 走
离开
去做
进行
变得
发出…声音
成为
处于…状态
轮到的顺序
精力
干劲
尝试
General Office 总部，总局

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"前进，行进，进展"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: advance, progress, proceed, move on, go
means: advance ：主要用于具体的人或物，也可指科学技术和运动等。
progress ：指按某一既定目标前进，取得发展，目的性很明确，强调经常和稳定地前进。
proceed ：侧重指继续前进。
move on ：非正式用语，侧重从某一停止点向某地前进，但不表示前进的目的地。
go ：最常用词，含义宽泛而不确切，依上文确定其具体意思。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均可表示"变成，成为"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: become, get, grow, turn, go, come
means: become ： 最普通用词，作为连系动词，指从一个状态向另一个状态的变化。
get ： 常指某人或某物有意无意地获得引起变化的因素，结果使变成另一状态。
grow ： 常指逐渐地变成新状态，强调渐变的过程。
turn ： 侧重指变得与原来截然不同，有时含贬义。
go ： 作为连系动词，通常与形容词连用，指进入某种状态，从而发生变化，多指不好的状态。
come ： 侧重变化的经过或过程，多用于不良情况。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"离开某处"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: depart, leave, go, start, quit, set out
means: depart ： 较正式用词，指经过周密考虑或郑重地离开，强调离开的起点。
leave ： 侧重出发地而不是目的地。
go ： 一般用词，指从所在地到其它地方去，着重目的地而非出发地。
start ： 可与leave换用，强调目的地，但不及leave普通。
quit ： 侧重指离开令人烦恼的地方，或摆脱使人不快的人或事。
set out ： 书面用词。

sentence.Network_en: No matter where you go in life or how old you get, there's always something new to learn about. After all, life is full of surprises.
sentence.Network_cn: 不管你生活在哪里，你有多少岁，总有新东西要学习，毕竟，生活总是充满惊喜。

sentence.Network_en: We'll go to a meeting in Birmingham and come straight back.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们将去伯明翰参加会议，然后马上回来。

sentence.Network_en: It's a long way to go for two people in their seventies.
sentence.Network_cn: 对于两个七十几岁的人来说，这段路太远了。

jx.jx_cn_mean: (英，非正式，旧)非常流行，风行一时

phrase.cizu_name: as (或 so) far as it goes

jx.jx_en_mean: bearing in mind its limitations (said when qualifying praise of something)
jx.jx_cn_mean: 考虑到它的局限性（在找理由表扬某事物时说）

lj.lj_ly: the book is a useful catalogue as far as it goes.
lj.lj_ls: 就这本书本身而言，它是个有用的目录。

jx.jx_en_mean: compared to the average or typical one of the specified kind
jx.jx_cn_mean: 与一般的（或典型的）相比

lj.lj_ly: as castles go it is small and old.
lj.lj_ls: 与一般城堡相比，它小而古老。

jx.jx_en_mean: (Brit. informal)make someone angry or sexually aroused

lj.lj_ly: I want a girl who's sexy, but in a subtle way—that's what gets me going.
lj.lj_ls: 我需要一个性感女孩，不过要隐隐约约地性感的那一种性感——就是能让我兴奋的那种类型。

jx.jx_en_mean: (N. Amer. informal)said to express the speaker's belief that something is amazing or incredible
jx.jx_cn_mean: (北美，非正式)［用来表示说话人认为某事是令人吃惊的，难以置信的］ 真不敢相信

jx.jx_en_mean: an auctioneer's announcement that bidding is closing or closed
jx.jx_cn_mean: （拍卖人宣布）竞价就要结束（或已结束）

phrase.cizu_name: going on ——(英亦作 going on for)

jx.jx_en_mean: (英 亦作)approaching a specified time, age, or amount
jx.jx_cn_mean: 接近（特定的时间、年龄或数量）

lj.lj_ly: I was going on fourteen when I went to my first gig.
lj.lj_ls: 我第一次乘快艇时已快14岁了。

jx.jx_en_mean: (Brit. informal)act in a vigorous, energetic, or dissipated way

lj.lj_ly: Go it, Dad! Give him what for!.
lj.lj_ls: 爸爸，猛点劲！给他一顿饱拳！。

jx.jx_en_mean: (或 prove)(of an occurrence) serve as evidence or proof of something specified
jx.jx_cn_mean: 成为某事的证据（或证明）

jx.jx_en_mean: (S. African)used to express good wishes to someone leaving
jx.jx_cn_mean: (南非)一切顺利［用来对即将离开的人表达良好的祝愿］

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English gān, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch gaan and German gehen; the form went was originally the past tense of wend
late 19th cent.: Japanese, literally 'small stone', also the name of the game

encyclopedia.content: SQLServer将GO解释为应将当前的SQL批处理语句发送给SQLServer的信号 GO 不是 Transact-SQL 语句；而是可为 osql 和 isql 实用工具及 SQL Server 查询分析器识别的命令。 SQL Server 实用工具将 GO 解释为应将当前的 Transact-SQL 批处理语句发送给 SQL Server 的信号。当前批处理语句是自上一 GO 命令后输入的所有语句，若是第一条 GO 命令，则是从特殊会话或脚本的开始处到这条 GO 命令之间的所有语句。SQL 查询分析器和 osql 及

usage_note.note: In most cases the past participle of go is gone, but occasionally you use ‘been’: see been.
usage_note.translation: 多数情况下，go的过去分词为 gone，偶尔也用been：见been。

entry.def: When you go somewhere, you move or travel there.

example.ex: We went to Rome...
example.tran: 我们去了罗马。

example.ex: Gladys had just gone into the kitchen...
example.tran: 格拉迪丝刚进厨房。

entry.def: When you go, you leave the place where you are.

example.ex: Let's go...
example.tran: 我们走吧。

example.ex: She's  going tomorrow.
example.tran: 她明天走。

entry.def: You use go to say that someone leaves the place where they are and does an activity, often a leisure activity.

example.ex: We went swimming very early...
example.tran: 我们很早就去游泳了。

example.ex: Maybe they've just gone shopping...
example.tran: 或许他们刚去购物了。

entry.tran: 去做…（可用go to do, 也可用go and do，美国英语中还可用go do，然而一般说 went and did）
entry.def: When you go to do something, you move to a place in order to do it and you do it. You can also go and do something, and in American English, you can go do something. However, you always say that someone went and did something.

example.ex: His second son, Paddy, had gone to live in Canada...
example.tran: 他的二儿子帕迪去加拿大生活了。

example.ex: I must go and see this film...
example.tran: 我一定要去看这部电影。

entry.def: If you go to school, work, or church, you attend it regularly as part of your normal life.

example.ex: She will have to go to school...
example.tran: 她将不得不去上学。

example.ex: His son went to a top university in America.
example.tran: 他的儿子上了美国的一所顶级大学。

entry.def: When you say where a road or path goes, you are saying where it begins or ends, or what places it is in.

example.ex: There's a mountain road that goes from Blairstown to Millbrook Village.
example.tran: 有一条山路从布莱尔斯敦通向米尔布鲁克村。

entry.tran: （用于否定表达中，表示对所提到行为不赞成或不允许某人有这种行为）
entry.def: You can use go in expressions such as 'don't go telling everybody', in order to express disapproval of the kind of behaviour you mention, or to tell someone not to behave in that way.

example.ex: You don't have to go running upstairs every time she rings...
example.tran: 用不着她一来电话你就往楼上跑。

example.ex: Don't you go thinking it was your fault.
example.tran: 别觉得是你的错。

entry.tran: （与further,beyond等词连用，表示某事的进展或程度）
entry.def: You can use go with words like 'further' and 'beyond' to show the degree or extent of something.

example.ex: He went even further in his speech to the conference...
example.tran: 他在大会发言中作了更进一步的阐述。

example.ex: Some physicists have gone so far as to suggest that the entire Universe is a sort of gigantic computer.
example.tran: 一些物理学家竟然提出整个宇宙就像一台巨型计算机。

entry.def: If you say that a period of time goes quickly or slowly, you mean that it seems to pass quickly or slowly.

example.ex: The weeks go so quickly!
example.tran: 这几周过得真快！

entry.def: If you say where money goes, you are saying what it is spent on.

example.ex: Most of my money goes on bills...
example.tran: 我的钱大部分用来支付各种账单。

example.ex: The money goes to projects chosen by the wider community.
example.tran: 这笔钱将用于由更广泛的社会群体所选出的项目。

entry.def: If you say that something goes to someone, you mean that it is given to them.

example.ex: A lot of credit must go to the chairman and his father...
example.tran: 很大一部分功劳应归于主席和他的父亲。

example.ex: The job went to Yuri Skokov, a capable administrator.
example.tran: 尤里·斯科科夫得到了这份工作，他是一位能干的管理人员。

entry.tran: 上，参加（电视或电台节目）
entry.def: If someone goes on television or radio, they take part in a television or radio programme.

example.ex: The Turkish president has gone on television to defend stringent new security measures...
example.tran: 土耳其总统上电视为严格的新安全措施进行辩护。

example.ex: We went on the air, live, at 7.30.
example.tran: 我们上了7点30分进行的现场直播。

entry.def: If something goes, someone gets rid of it.

example.ex: The Institute of Export now fears that 100,000 jobs will go...
example.tran: 现在出口协会担心将失去10万个工作机会。

example.ex: If people stand firm against the tax, it is only a matter of time before it has to go.
example.tran: 如果人们坚决抵制这项税收，它的废止就仅仅是个时间问题。

entry.def: If someone goes, they leave their job, usually because they are forced to.

example.ex: He had made a humiliating tactical error and he had to go.
example.tran: 他犯了一个让他颜面尽失的战术错误，只得引咎辞职。

entry.def: If something goes into something else, it is put in it as one of the parts or elements that form it.

example.ex: ...the really interesting ingredients that go into the dishes that we all love to eat.
example.tran: 我们都爱吃的菜肴里所放入的十分有趣的原料

entry.def: If something goes in a particular place, it fits in that place or should be put there because it is the right size or shape.

example.ex: He was trying to push it through the hole and it wouldn't go.
example.tran: 他想将它从这个洞里推过去，但却怎么也过不去。

example.ex: ...This knob goes here.
example.tran: 这个拉手要装在这里。

entry.def: If something goes in a particular place, it belongs there or should be put there, because that is where you normally keep it.

example.ex: The shoes go on the shoe shelf...
example.tran: 鞋子放在鞋架上。

example.ex: 'Where does everything go?'
example.tran: “东西都到哪儿去了？”

entry.def: If you say that one number goes into another number a particular number of times, you are dividing the second number by the first.

example.ex: Six goes into thirty five times.

entry.def: If one of a person's senses, such as their sight or hearing, is going, it is getting weak and they may soon lose it completely.

example.ex: His eyes are going; he says he has glaucoma...
example.tran: 他的视力在下降，他说自己得了青光眼。

example.ex: Lately he'd been making mistakes; his nerve was beginning to go.
example.tran: 他近来老犯错误，胆子也开始变小了。

entry.tran: （灯泡、引擎等)损坏，报废，无法正常运转
entry.def: If something such as a light bulb or a part of an engine is going, it is no longer working properly and will soon need to be replaced.

example.ex: I thought it looked as though the battery was going.
example.tran: 我看电池好像该换了。

entry.def: If you say that someone is going or has gone, you are saying in an indirect way that they are dying or are dead.

example.ex: 'Any hope?' — 'No, he's gone.'
example.tran: “还有希望吗？”——“没有，他已经死了。”

entry.def: You can use go to say that a person or thing changes to another state or condition. For example, if someone goes crazy, they become crazy, and if something goes green, it changes colour and becomes green.

example.ex: I'm going bald...
example.tran: 我开始秃头了。

example.ex: You'd better serve it to them before it goes cold...
example.tran: 你最好趁热给他们端上桌。

entry.def: You can use go when indicating whether or not someone wears or has something. For example, if someone goes barefoot, they do not wear any shoes.

example.ex: The baby went naked on the beach...
example.tran: 这个小宝贝光着身子在沙滩上。

example.ex: But if you arm the police won't more criminals go armed?
example.tran: 但是，如果你给警察配备武器，难道不会出现更多配备武器的罪犯吗？

entry.tran: （用在以un开头的形容词之前表示某事没有发生）
entry.def: You can use go before adjectives beginning with 'un-' to say that something does not happen. For example, if something goes unheard, nobody hears it.

example.ex: As President, he affirmed that no tyranny went unnoticed.
example.tran: 他以总统的名义宣称没有对任何暴行置若罔闻。

collins.item: OTHER VERB USES, NOUN USES, AND PHRASES
collins.tran: 其他动词用法，名词用法与短语

entry.def: You use go to talk about the way something happens. For example, if an event or situation goes well, it is successful.

example.ex: She says everything is going smoothly...
example.tran: 她说一切进展顺利。

example.ex: How did it go at the hairdresser's?
example.tran: 你去理发店理得还算满意吗？

entry.def: If a machine or device is going, it is working.

example.ex: What about my copier? Can you get it going again?...
example.tran: 我的复印机怎么样了？你能把它修好吗？

example.ex: I said, 'My car won't  go in fog'.
example.tran: 我说：“我的车在雾天里没法开。”

entry.def: If a bell goes, it makes a noise, usually as a signal for you to do something.

example.ex: The bell went for the break.
example.tran: 课间休息铃响了。

entry.def: If something goes with something else, or if two things go together, they look or taste nice together.

example.ex: I was searching for a pair of grey gloves to go with my new gown...
example.tran: 我在找一副跟我的新礼服相配的灰色手套。

example.ex: I can see that some colours go together and some don't...
example.tran: 我看得出来有些颜色相配，有些却不协调。

entry.def: You use go to introduce something you are quoting. For example, you say the story goes or the argument goes just before you quote all or part of it.

example.ex: The story goes that she went home with him that night...
example.tran: 据说她那天晚上跟他一起回了家。

example.ex: The story goes like this...
example.tran: 事情据说是这样的。

entry.def: You use go when indicating that something makes or produces a sound. For example, if you say that something goes 'bang', you mean it produces the sound 'bang'.

example.ex: She stopped in front of a painting of a dog and she started going 'woof woof'...
example.tran: 她在一幅狗的画像前停下来，开始“汪汪”地学起狗叫来。

example.ex: The button on his jeans went POP.
example.tran: 他牛仔服上的纽扣发出“啪”的响声。

entry.tran: 说（代替say，表示引述他人的话或认为他们要说的话）
entry.def: You can use go instead of 'say' when you are quoting what someone has said or what you think they will say.

example.ex: They say 'Tom, shut up' and I go 'No, you shut up'...
example.tran: 他们说：“汤姆，你闭嘴！”我说：“才不呢，你们闭嘴！”

example.ex: He goes to me: 'Oh, what do you want?'
example.tran: 他问我：“哦，你想要什么？”

entry.def: A go is an attempt at doing something.

example.ex: I always wanted to have a go at football...
example.tran: 我一直都想试试踢足球。

example.ex: She won on her first go...
example.tran: 她第一次尝试就赢了。

entry.def: If it is your go in a game, it is your turn to do something, for example to play a card or move a piece.

example.ex: I'm two behind you but it's your go...
example.tran: 我落后你两步，但现在轮到你走了。

example.ex: Now whose go is it?
example.tran: 现在轮到谁了？

entry.tran: 全力以赴；不遗余力地做
entry.def: If you go all out to do something or go all out for something, you make the greatest possible effort to do it or get it.

example.ex: They will go all out to get exactly what they want...
example.tran: 他们将尽最大努力实现自己的愿望。

example.ex: They're  ready to go all out for the Premier League title next season.
example.tran: 他们准备全力以赴，夺取下赛季的超级联赛冠军。

entry.tran: 干（或说）什么都行；什么事都不新鲜
entry.def: If people say 'anything goes', they mean that anything people say or do is considered acceptable, and usually they mean that they do not approve of this.

example.ex: In the 90s, almost anything goes.
example.tran: 在90年代几乎无奇不有。

entry.tran: 与同类的事物相比/跟其他小孩相比
entry.def: You use expressions like as things go  or as children go when you are describing one person or thing and comparing them with others of the same kind.

example.ex: This is a straightforward case, as these things go...
example.tran: 同其他同类情况相比，这件事还算简单。

example.ex: He's  good company, as small boys go.
example.tran: 与其他小男孩相比，他挺好相处。

entry.def: If you do something as you go along, you do it while you are doing another thing, without preparing it beforehand.

example.ex: Learning how to become a parent takes time. It's a skill you learn as you go along.
example.tran: 学会如何为人父母需要时间，这种技能只能边经历边学习。

entry.def: If you say that someone has gone and done something, you are expressing your annoyance at the foolish thing they have done.

example.ex: Well, he's gone and done it again, hasn't he?...
example.tran: 噢，他又干傻事了，是吧？

example.ex: Somebody goes and does something mindless like that and just destroys everything for you.
example.tran: 总有人干这种没头没脑的事，把你的事情全弄砸。

entry.def: You say 'Go for it' to encourage someone to increase their efforts to achieve or win something.
If someone has a go at you, they criticize you, often in a way that you feel is unfair.

example.ex: Some people had a go at us for it, which made us more angry.
example.tran: 一些人因为此事攻击我们，这使我们更加气愤。

entry.def: If someone says 'Where do we go from here?' they are asking what should be done next, usually because a problem has not been solved in a satisfactory way.
If you say that someone is making a go of something such as a business or relationship, you mean that they are having some success with it.

example.ex: I knew we could make a go of it and be happy.
example.tran: 我知道我们能做成这件事并且会很开心。

entry.def: If you say that someone is always on the go, you mean that they are always busy and active.

example.ex: I got a new job this year where I am on the go all the time.
example.tran: 我今年找了份新工作，一直忙得不可开交。

entry.def: If you have something on the go, you have started it and are busy doing it.

example.ex: Do you like to have many projects on the go at any one time?
example.tran: 你喜欢一次忙多个项目吗？

entry.def: If you say that there are a particular number of things to go, you mean that they still remain to be dealt with.

example.ex: I still had another five operations to go.
example.tran: 我还有5例手术要做。

entry.def: If you say that there is a certain amount of time to go, you mean that there is that amount of time left before something happens or ends.

example.ex: There is a week to go until the elections.
example.tran: 离选举还有一周的时间。

entry.def: If you are in a café or restaurant and ask for an item of food to go, you mean that you want to take it away with you and not eat it there.

example.ex: Large fries to go.
example.tran: 大份炸薯条带走。

means.word_mean: 1. a time for working (after which you will be relieved by someone else);
4. a board game for two players who place counters on a grid; the object is to surround and so capture the opponent's counters
1. change location; move, travel, or proceed;

sentences.sentence: "How fast does your new car go?"
"We travelled from Rome to Naples by bus"
"The policemen went from door to door looking for the suspect"
"The soldiers moved towards the city in an attempt to take it before night fell"

means.word_mean: 2. follow a procedure or take a course;

sentences.sentence: "We should go farther in this matter"
"She went through a lot of trouble"
"go about the world in a certain manner"

means.word_mean: 3. move away from a place into another direction;

sentences.sentence: "Go away before I start to cry"

means.word_mean: 4. enter or assume a certain state or condition;

sentences.sentence: "He became annoyed when he heard the bad news"
"the story or argument runs as follows"

means.word_mean: 7. stretch out over a distance, space, time, or scope; run or extend between two points or beyond a certain point;

sentences.sentence: "Service runs all the way to Cranbury"
"My memory extends back to my fourth year of life"
"The facts extend beyond a consideration of her personal assets"
"These luxuries all had to go under the Khmer Rouge"

means.word_mean: 10. be or continue to be in a certain condition;
11. make a certain noise or sound;

sentences.sentence: "The washing machine won't go unless it's plugged in"
"Does this old car still run well?"
"The money had gone after a few days"
"Gas is running low at the gas stations in the Midwest"
"The speech has to go through several more drafts"
"run through your presentation before the meeting"

means.word_mean: 15. continue to live; endure or last;

sentences.sentence: "We went without water and food for 3 days"
"These superstitions survive in the backwaters of America"
"The racecar driver lived through several very serious accidents"

means.word_mean: 16. pass, fare, or elapse; of a certain state of affairs or action;

sentences.sentence: "The day went well until I got your call"

means.word_mean: 17. pass from physical life and lose all all bodily attributes and functions necessary to sustain life;
18. be in the right place or situation;

sentences.sentence: "Let's put health care where it belongs--under the control of the government"
"This violinist is as good as Juilliard-trained violinists go"
"I start at eight in the morning"

means.word_mean: 21. have a turn; make one's move in a game;

sentences.sentence: "This flavor will blend with those in your dish"
"This sofa won't go with the chairs"

means.word_mean: 26. be the right size or shape; fit correctly or as desired;

sentences.sentence: "This piece won't fit into the puzzle"

means.word_mean: 27. go through in search of something; search through someone's belongings in an unauthorized way;

sentences.sentence: "All my money went for food and rent"

means.word_mean: 29. give support (to) or make a choice (of) one out of a group or number;

sentences.sentence: "The bus we travelled in broke down on the way to town"
"The engine failed on the way to town"

means.word_mean: 1. functioning correctly and ready for action;

list.explanation: 作变性手术(源出于最初此类手术大多在丹麦进行)
受雇于迪斯科舞厅或夜总会跳狂舞的舞女

example.en: She is too fat to be a go-go girl.
example.zh: 她太胖了，当不了舞女了。

list.explanation: (赞扬和鼓励语)干得非常出色。那太好了

example.en: That's the way to go. You guys built the airport so quickly.
example.zh: 干得非常出色。你们这么快就把机场建成了。

list.explanation: (表示赞赏、鼓励的感叹语)太棒了!干得好! Go-man-go! She's just full of jazz.太棒了!她真的浑身是劲儿。
(便餐柜台用语)非堂吃的、包好的、买了可以带走的(食品)

example.en: Do you want it to go,or will you eat it here?
example.zh: 你要买包好了外卖的呢，还是要在这儿堂吃的？

list.explanation: 走到极限.走极端.什么都干得出来

example.en: These people would unhesitatingly go the limit.
example.zh: 这些人会毫无顾忌地走极端。

slang.tokens: go over like a lead balloon

example.en: The joke went over like a lead balloon.
example.zh: 这笑话说得一点也不好笑。

example.en: My appeal to his better nature went over like a lead balloon.
example.zh: 我求他发发善心，结果是白费劲。

list.explanation: 情况就同我向你说的一样。瞧，我不是说对了吗？

example.en: There you go，the prices went up again!
example.zh: 瞧，不出所料，价格又涨上去了!

list.explanation: 你又在这样干了。你还是老一套

example.en: I just told you not to put that junk on the table and there you go.
example.zh: 我才对你说过，别把那种破烂东叫放在桌上,而你又放了。

example.en: They soon stopped sparring and went to the mat.
example.zh: 他们刚吵了几句，接着就打起来了。

example.en: The union may go to the mat with the management over wages.
example.zh: 工会可能与资方就工资问题进行激烈争论。

list.explanation: (尤指在赛马中)作出极大努力，跑得很快

example.en: I suppose the chestnut horse will go for the doctor and get a huge win at this races.
example.zh: 我想那匹叫栗色马 一定会跑得很快,在 这次赛马会上准会大获成功。

example.en: I'll go for tlie doctor thai he's there.

example.zh: 我这颗老兵的心激动得兴奋不已。

auth_sentence.content: The Greek side go through to the Europa League.
auth_sentence.res_content: The Greek side go through to the Europa League.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The Greek side go through to the Europa League.

auth_sentence.content: I returned home to go to a local school.
auth_sentence.res_content: I returned home to go to a local school.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I returned home to go to a local school.

auth_sentence.content: But China now plans to go one step further.
auth_sentence.res_content: But China now plans to go one step further.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But China now plans to go one step further.

means.word_mean: 去; 走; 行; 驶

sentences.en: I want to go, but she wants to stay.
sentences.cn: 我要走, 但她想留下来。

sentences.en: I told the driver to go slow.
The train is going north.
The train goes in 15 minutes.
She has gone to the station.
He went to see his aunt last night.
sentences.cn: 他昨天晚上去看望了姨母。

sentences.en: Go and have a glass of beer!
I'm going to enter a university.
He often goes marketing.

means.word_mean: 进行, 运行, 运转

sentences.en: Everything went pretty smoothly.
There are still two years to go.
The engine went beautifully.
sentences.cn: 这台发动机运转得相当好。

means.word_mean: 放, 置，被放置，被置于，被安放

sentences.en: My clothes won't all go into that tiny suitcase.
sentences.cn: 那个小衣箱装不下我所有的衣物。

sentences.en: The shirts go in the top drawer.
sentences.cn: 衬衫放在最上层的抽屉里。

means.word_mean: 伸展, 通往，（从…）通向，延伸到

sentences.en: Where does this road go to?
I want a rope long enough to go from here to there.
sentences.cn: 我要一根可以从这里拉到那里的长绳子。

sentences.en: The roots of this plant go deep.
sentences.cn: 这种植物的根扎得很深。

sentences.en: My fever has gone, but I have a cough.
sentences.cn: 我退烧了, 但是还有点咳嗽。

sentences.en: He got up in the morning and found that all the snow had gone.
sentences.cn: 他早晨起来发现雪已经全部消失了。

sentences.en: My purse has gone!
The ladder went at the critical moment.
The bridge went under the heavy weight.
My money is going fast!
A lot of my grant goes on books.
sentences.cn: 我的许多补助金都花在书上。

sentences.en: How much of your money goes in rent?
sentences.cn: 你花在租金上的钱是多少?

sentences.en: These socks are going at one pound a pair.
sentences.cn: 这些短袜每双卖一英镑。

sentences.en: The antique table went to the lady in the pink hat.
sentences.cn: 这张古董桌子卖给那位戴粉红色帽子的女士了。

sentences.en: The story goes that he was murdered.
The story goes that long ago there lived a king.
sentences.cn: 流传着这样一个故事, 讲的是很久以前有个国王。

sentences.en: This is how the song goes.
Ducks go “quack”.
The guns went “boom”.

means.word_mean: 变得, 成为, 处于…状态

sentences.en: The woman had gone mad.
Fruit quickly goes rotten in hot weather.
sentences.cn: 在热天, 水果会很快变质。

sentences.en: He went pale at the news.
sentences.cn: 他听到这个消息时脸色变得苍白。

sentences.en: My absence had gone unnoticed.
sentences.cn: 我的缺席未能引起人家注意。

sentences.en: You've been on the swing for ten minutes, it's my go now.
sentences.cn: 你荡秋千有10分钟了, 现在该轮到我了。

sentences.en: You'll be given a go next time.

means.word_mean: 精力, 干劲，活力，热情

sentences.en: The youth has plenty of go in him.
The children are full of go.They run and play all day.
sentences.cn: 这些小孩子精力充沛, 他们整天跑呀玩呀。

jushi.english: My fever has gone, but I have a cough.
jushi.chinese: 我不发烧了,但是还有点咳嗽。

jushi.english: After George went, she moved into a smaller house.
jushi.chinese: 乔治死了以后,她搬进了一所较小的房子。
